climb helps families build their financial capability by learning which bills to prioritize when they don't have enough to pay them all. Users can take pictures of their bills, and climb will analyze them and tell them which bills are most important for them to pay first based on their interest rates, late fees, and real life consequences.

climb also helps people move from reactive to proactive. When users add their bank accounts, climb can analyze patterns in expenses and income to help make personalized recommendations (i.e. to change due dates, set up payment plans, etc.) and help them develop emergency savings and pay down debt.

Built With

  • android
  • ios
  • windows-phone

An app that relies on understanding behavior in order to help anyone easily manage personal finances.

Built With

  • android

Circle Saver uses social encouragement to positively enforce saving behavior while tracking progress against individual savings goals. It also provides an emergency source of credit in times of emergencies that lowers the pain of asking to borrow money and increases the social pressure to pay it back. Enabling these behaviors can bring a structured way to success to those who find accumulating savings impossibly challenging.

Circle Saver allows you to make goals, add savings and apply it to those goals, and both send and receive messages of encouragement in response to savings and goal setting activity. After a period of time, it also extends short term credit for emergency situations. Interest and fees on very short to short term credit made up $70 billion of the $89 billion market of revenue from the financially underserved.

This app features a group activity feed (and the ability to like and comment), a goals list, team member profiles, ability to add funds/save and withdraw savings/borrow.

A mobile app that helps with being on top of your daily spending including your spend for the household. That lets you see the money your immediate family is spending to maintain the household and lets you contribute to a shared emergency fund. And finally a way to unlock the emergency fund and enlist your friends & extended family to help with any shortfall in tough times.

Built With

  • envision
  • asp.net
  • photoshop
  • balsamiq
  • ios
  • web

This app allows people to round up purchases to the nearest dollar. Then place that change into a shared account that can then be loaned out in larger amounts to people as a micro loan. The person will then earn interest and fees directly on their portion of the loaned out money. The app can be used to track the loans they have extended (through the service). Check on external loans they have taken. Also it is an interface for them to take out a micro loan themselves if needed.

Through gamification of the loan management process, the app encourages behavior that can help pull the user through a tough money period. It will also provide a MYLO credit score, that will give the user a visual insight in how they are paying back loans and lines of credit. All the while giving more transparency into how all of the monetary transactions are interacting via a Dashboard.

The app will encourage social interactions, by having a timeline that users can comment on, or send virtual gifts to people, via points that are earned when good financial behavior is exhibited.

The users can also earn badges for undesirable financial behavior. (this is not good.) However there is the option that the user can "Lose" the "bad badge" with extended good behavior. This is to acknowledge the fact that mistakes can be made, but the app with it's extended "friends" will help you through, until you are on your way to financial success through changed behaviors, and sharing the change.

The app will try to clearly in layman's terms explain financial concepts.

Built With

  • jquery
  • titanium
  • web
  • ios

Idea: This App tries to augment the income of financially underserved markets. The two diaries we read (the Rodriguez family & the Johnsons) both needed better money flow but what they also need is an income source for short term (months when emergency expenses are high). In these scenarios augmenting income from part time/hourly jobs can help to tide over shortfall. The CFSI study also points that more than 60% of adults in underserved households have 2 or more jobs, if we can help these households to find better paying & faster access to jobs it would help them immensely. Also this app can be combined with another budget tracking app so that in months of budgetary shortfall an hourly job can be suggested to make up the difference. Killer Functionality: The App goes beyond the basic qualification matrix that most of the job sites use. We are implementing a text classification based engine (etcML) that uses soft skills as well as user’s preference over time to customize the jobs they see. In every listing user can like or dislike a job this will allow the tool to learn more about the user and give better suited jobs over time. Finally, it allows users to apply for the jobs from the app so that they can minimize the time spent on individual applications.

Built With

  • taskrabbit
